Sentencas: This paper describes the results of a study undertaken to determine the impact of fuel cell technology on the design and effectiveness of future naval surface combatants.
Titulo: FUEL-CELL POWER-PLANTS FOR SURFACE FLEET APPLICATIONS

Sentencas: The study involved the collection of data to characterize four different fuel cell technologies: proton exchange membrane, molten carbonate, phosphoric acid, and solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: FUEL-CELL POWER-PLANTS FOR SURFACE FLEET APPLICATIONS

Sentencas: This information was used to expand current computer models to develop specific fuel cell plants that met the power requirements for several applications on a nominal 5000 Lton destroyer and a nominal 2000 Lton corvette.
Titulo: FUEL-CELL POWER-PLANTS FOR SURFACE FLEET APPLICATIONS

Sentencas: Each of the fuel cell technologies was incorporated into several applications aboard the destroyer and the corvette.
Titulo: FUEL-CELL POWER-PLANTS FOR SURFACE FLEET APPLICATIONS

Sentencas: These applications included combinations of centralized and distributed ship service power, and propulsion power.
Titulo: FUEL-CELL POWER-PLANTS FOR SURFACE FLEET APPLICATIONS

Sentencas: In addition, the impact of fuel cell technology was determined for a ship service power backfit option aboard a DDG-51 class destroyer.
Titulo: FUEL-CELL POWER-PLANTS FOR SURFACE FLEET APPLICATIONS

Sentencas: The results of the impact on the ship designs were analyzed and a military effectiveness assessment was conducted to address such issues as the impact of fuel cells on mobility, survivability, affordability, and on the environment.
Titulo: FUEL-CELL POWER-PLANTS FOR SURFACE FLEET APPLICATIONS

Sentencas: The paper identifies which aspects of the fuel cell technologies have the greatest impact upon the ship designs and their operational costs.
Titulo: FUEL-CELL POWER-PLANTS FOR SURFACE FLEET APPLICATIONS

Sentencas: Recommendations are given for future technology development efforts required to make fuel cells suitable for Navy service.
Titulo: FUEL-CELL POWER-PLANTS FOR SURFACE FLEET APPLICATIONS
